captiveportaldnstest_beginning_resolutio.description: Logger record for noting a new DNS resolution attempt.

captiveportaldnstest_log_address_returne.description: Logger record for DNS response address.

captiveportaldnstest_log_statuscode_retu.description: Logger record for DNS response status code.

captiveportaldnstest_no_addr_returned.description: Logger record for when DNS resolution returns no address field.

captiveportaldnstest_no_problem_threshol.message: A DNS captive portal is not present if the IP for all of the hostnames queried is a Google IP

captiveportaldnstest_noproblem_subtitle.description: Subtitle for when no problem is found with the DNS Captive Portal test.
captiveportaldnstest_noproblem_subtitle.message: No captive portal found. A captive portal is a website that a network requires its users to view and interact with before being granted access to browse the Internet freely.

captiveportaldnstest_noproblem_title.description: Title for when no problem is found with the DNS Captive Portal test.
captiveportaldnstest_noproblem_title.message: Internet traffic not blocked by captive portal (DNS)

captiveportaldnstest_noresult_code_retur.description: Logger record for when DNS resolution returns no result status code field.
captiveportaldnstest_noresult_code_retur.message: test; no result status code; aborting test due to test failure.

captiveportaldnstest_potential_problem_s.description: Subtitle for when a potential problem is found with the DNS Captive Portal test.
captiveportaldnstest_potential_problem_s.message: A captive portal is a website that a network requires its users to view and interact with before being granted access to browse the Internet freely. A captive portal appears to be on your network, meaning access to the Internet is probably restricted.

captiveportaldnstest_potential_problem_t.description: Title for when a potential problem is found with the DNS Captive Portal test.
captiveportaldnstest_potential_problem_t.message: Internet traffic may be blocked by captive portal (DNS)

captiveportaldnstest_problem_subtitle.description: Subtitle for when a problem is found with the DNS Captive Portal test.
captiveportaldnstest_problem_subtitle.message: A captive portal is a website that a network requires its users to view and interact with before being granted access to browse the Internet freely. A captive portal was found on your network, meaning access to the Internet is restricted.

captiveportaldnstest_problem_threshold.message: A DNS captive portal is present when the IP for any queried Google hostname is not properly resolve to a Google IP address

captiveportaldnstest_problem_title.description: Title for when a problem is found with the DNS Captive Portal test.
captiveportaldnstest_problem_title.message: Internet traffic blocked by captive portal (DNS)

captiveportaldnstest_title.description: Title for captive portal DNS test

resolverlatencytest_noproblem_subtitle.description: Subtitle for when no problem is found with the DNS Latency test.
resolverlatencytest_noproblem_subtitle.message: A DNS server translates a hostname (e.g. google.co.uk) into an IP (e.g. 74.125.228.98). This process is required in order for your  browser to connect to the Internet. Chrome is able to quickly resolve DNS requests using your local resolver, which speeds up the process of loading a page.

resolverlatencytest_noproblem_title.description: Title for when no problem is found with the DNS Latency test.

resolverlatencytest_potential_problem_su.description: Subtitle for when a potential problem is found with the DNS Latency test.
resolverlatencytest_potential_problem_su.message: A DNS server translates a hostname (e.g. www.google.co.uk) into an IP address. A browser must have an IP address to connect to in order to load a website. The DNS server that performs this translation is taking too long, causing delays in your Internet connection.

resolverlatencytest_potential_problem_ti.description: Logger record for dns resolution time for which we render a potential problem verdict.
resolverlatencytest_potential_problem_ti.message: Average DNS resolution time (ms) benchmark under which a potential problem verdict is rendered:

resolverlatencytest_potentialproblem_tit.description: Title for when a potential problem is found with the DNS Latency test.
resolverlatencytest_potentialproblem_tit.message: DNS resolution taking longer than average

resolverlatencytest_problem_subtitle.description: Subtitle for when a problem is found with the DNS Latency test.
resolverlatencytest_problem_subtitle.message: A DNS server translates a hostname (e.g. www.google.co.uk) into an IP address. A browser must have an IP address to connect to in order to load a website. The DNS server that performs this translation is taking too long, causing delays in your Internet connection.

resolverlatencytest_problem_time.message: Average DNS resolution time (ms) benchmark above which a problem verdict is rendered:

resolverlatencytest_problem_title.description: Title for when a problem is found with the DNS Latency test.

resolverpresenttest_noproblem_subtitle.description: Subtitle for when no problem is found with the DNS Resolver Present test.

resolverpresenttest_noproblem_title.description: Title for when no problem is found with the DNS Resolver Present test.

resolverpresenttest_problem_subtitle.description: Subtitle for when a problem is found with the DNS Resolver Present test.
resolverpresenttest_problem_subtitle.message: A DNS server translates a hostname (e.g. www.google.co.uk) into an IP address. A browser must have an IP address to connect to in order to load a website. Chrome is unable to determine the IP of the website you want to visit because your DNS server is not working.

resolverpresenttest_statuscoderesultsucc.description: Logger record denoting the successful DNS query status code result

resolverpresenttest_testcompleted.message: DNS server returned DNS query results.

resolverpresenttest_testfailed.description: Logger record denoting that the resolverpresenttest failed as the resolver did not return any result (even an error)
